org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy

Class PunctuationPolicy<IN,DATA>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy.PunctuationPolicy<IN,DATA>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - The type of the input data handled by this policy. An Extractor can be used to extract DATA for IN.
    DATA - The type of the punctuation. An Extractor can be used to extract DATA for IN.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, CloneableEvictionPolicy<IN>, CloneableTriggerPolicy<IN>, EvictionPolicy<IN>, TriggerPolicy<IN>

    public class PunctuationPolicy<IN,DATA>
extends Object
implements CloneableTriggerPolicy<IN>, CloneableEvictionPolicy<IN>
    This policy can be used to trigger and evict based on a punctuation which is present within the arriving data. Using this policy, one can react on an externally defined arbitrary windowing semantic. In case this policy is used for eviction, the complete buffer will get deleted in case the punctuation is detected. By default this policy does not react on fake elements. Wrap it in an ActiveEvictionPolicyWrapper to make it react on punctuation even in fake elements.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      PunctuationPolicy(DATA punctuation)
      Creates the punctuation policy without using any extractor.

      Creates the punctuation policy which uses the specified extractor to isolate the punctuation from the data.

        punctuation - the punctuation which leads to trigger/evict.

        extractor - An Extractor which converts IN to DATA.

    • Method Detail

      • notifyEviction

        public int notifyEviction(IN datapoint,
                 boolean triggered,
                 int bufferSize)
        Description copied from interface: EvictionPolicy
        Proves if and how many elements should be deleted from the element buffer. The eviction takes place after the trigger and after the call to the UDF but before the adding of the new data point.
        Specified by:
        notifyEviction in interface EvictionPolicy<IN>
        Parameters:
        datapoint - data point the data point which arrived
        triggered - Information whether the UDF was triggered or not
        bufferSize - The current size of the element buffer at the invokable
        Returns:
        The number of elements to be deleted from the buffer

      • notifyTrigger

        public boolean notifyTrigger(IN datapoint)
        Description copied from interface: TriggerPolicy
        Proves and returns if a new window should be started. In case the trigger occurs (return value true) the UDF will be executed on the current element buffer without the last added element which is provided as parameter. This element will be added to the buffer after the execution of the UDF. There are possibly different strategies for eviction and triggering: 1) including last data point: Better/faster for count eviction 2) excluding last data point: Essentially required for time based eviction and delta rules As 2) is required for some policies and the benefit of using 1) is small for the others, policies are implemented according to 2).
        Specified by:
        notifyTrigger in interface TriggerPolicy<IN>
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the data point which arrived
        Returns:
        true if the current windows should be closed, otherwise false. In true case the given data point will be part of the next window and will not be included in the current one.
